body:
Please change the behavior of `spack list` to do what `spack find` does. Consider adding `spack search` as well.

### Rationale

To be more consistent with other open source package managers, the `spack list` command should print out all locally installed packages. Here are the commands from some other package managers:

| Package Manager      | Community | CLI Tool | Installed Packages        | All Packages |
|----------------------|----------|---------|---------------------------|--------------|
| spack                | HPC       | spack    | find                      | list         |
| homebrew             | Mac       | brew     | list                      | search       |
| MacPorts             | Mac       | port     | installed                 | list, search |
| Pypi                 | Python    | pip      | list                      | search       |
| RubyGems             | Ruby      | gem      | list (--local by default) | list -r      |
| Rust                 | Rust      | cargo    |                           | search       |
| Node Package Manager | NodeJS    | npm      | ls                        | search       |

No one *ever* wants a print out of a list that is longer than their terminal buffer. To make the change easier on users, maybe add a `-r/--remote` option to list command to get the original behavior, otherwise, default to `spack find` behavior.
title: Change the functionality of `spack list`
